info.title: Sui JSON-RPC
info.description: Sui JSON-RPC API for interaction with Sui Full node.

methods.name: sui_batchTransaction
methods.description: Create an unsigned batched transaction.

params.name: signer
params.description: the transaction signer's Sui address

params.name: single_transaction_params
params.description: list of transaction request parameters

params.name: gas
params.description: gas object to be used in this transaction, node will pick one from the signer's possession if not provided

params.name: gas_budget
params.description: the gas budget, the transaction will fail if the gas cost exceed the budget

params.name: txn_builder_mode
params.description: Whether this is a regular transaction or a Dev Inspect Transaction

arguments: An NFT created by the Sui Command Line Tool

methods.name: sui_devInspectTransaction
methods.description: Runs the transaction in dev-inpsect mode. Which allows for nearly any transaction (or Move call) with any arguments. Detailed results are provided, including both the transaction effects and any return values.

params.name: tx_bytes
params.description: BCS encoded TransactionKind(as opposed to TransactionData, which include gasBudget and gasPrice)

params.name: gas_price
params.description: Gas is not charged, but gas usage is still calculated. Default to use reference gas price

params.name: epoch
params.description: The epoch to perform the call. Will be set from the system state object if not provided

methods.name: sui_dryRunTransaction
methods.description: Return transaction execution effects including the gas cost summary, while the effects are not committed to the chain.

methods.name: sui_executeTransaction
methods.description: Execute the transaction and wait for results if desired. Request types: 1. WaitForEffectsCert: waits for TransactionEffectsCert and then return to client.     This mode is a proxy for transaction finality. 2. WaitForLocalExecution: waits for TransactionEffectsCert and make sure the node     executed the transaction locally before returning the client. The local execution     makes sure this node is aware of this transaction when client fires subsequent queries.     However if the node fails to execute the transaction locally in a timely manner,     a bool type in the response is set to false to indicated the case.

params.name: tx_bytes
params.description: BCS serialized transaction data bytes without its type tag, as base-64 encoded string.

params.name: signature
params.description: `flag || signature || pubkey` bytes, as base-64 encoded string, signature is committed to the intent message of the transaction data, as base-64 encoded string.

params.name: request_type
params.description: The request type

examples.name: Execute an transaction with serialized signature

params.name: tx_bytes
params.description: BCS serialized transaction data bytes without its type tag, as base-64 encoded string.

params.name: signature
params.description: `flag || signature || pubkey` bytes, as base-64 encoded string, signature is committed to the intent message of the transaction data, as base-64 encoded string.

params.name: request_type
params.description: The request type

methods.name: sui_getAllBalances
methods.description: Return the total coin balance for all coin type, owned by the address owner.

params.name: owner
params.description: the owner's Sui address

methods.name: sui_getAllCoins
methods.description: Return all Coin objects owned by an address.

params.name: owner
params.description: the owner's Sui address

params.name: cursor
params.description: optional paging cursor

params.name: limit
params.description: maximum number of items per page

methods.name: sui_getBalance
methods.description: Return the total coin balance for one coin type, owned by the address owner.

params.name: owner
params.description: the owner's Sui address

params.name: coin_type
params.description: optional type names for the coin (e.g., 0x168da5bf1f48dafc111b0a488fa454aca95e0b5e::usdc::USDC), default to 0x2::sui::SUI if not specified.

methods.name: sui_getCheckpointContents
methods.description: Return contents of a checkpoint, namely a list of execution digests

methods.name: sui_getCheckpointContentsByDigest
methods.description: Return contents of a checkpoint based on checkpoint content digest

methods.name: sui_getCheckpointSummary
methods.description: Return a checkpoint summary based on a checkpoint sequence number

methods.name: sui_getCheckpointSummaryByDigest
methods.description: Return a checkpoint summary based on checkpoint digest

methods.name: sui_getCoinMetadata
methods.description: Return metadata(e.g., symbol, decimals) for a coin

params.description: type name for the coin (e.g., 0x168da5bf1f48dafc111b0a488fa454aca95e0b5e::usdc::USDC)

methods.name: sui_getCoins
methods.description: Return all Coin<`coin_type`> objects owned by an address.

params.name: cursor
params.description: optional paging cursor

params.name: limit
params.description: maximum number of items per page

methods.name: sui_getCommitteeInfo
methods.description: Return the committee information for the asked `epoch`.

params.name: epoch
params.description: The epoch of interest. If None, default to the latest epoch

methods.name: sui_getDelegatedStakes
methods.description: Return all [DelegatedStake].

methods.name: sui_getEvents

params.name: descending_order
params.description: query result ordering, default to false (ascending order), oldest record first.

methods.name: sui_getTransactionsInRange
methods.description: Return list of transaction digests within the queried range.

params.description: the matching transactions' sequence number will be greater than or equals to the starting sequence number

params.name: end

methods.name: sui_getValidators
methods.description: Return all validators available for stake delegation.

methods.name: sui_mergeCoins
methods.description: Create an unsigned transaction to merge multiple coins into one coin.

params.name: signer
params.description: the transaction signer's Sui address

params.name: primary_coin
params.description: the coin object to merge into, this coin will remain after the transaction

params.name: coin_to_merge
params.description: the coin object to be merged, this coin will be destroyed, the balance will be added to `primary_coin`

params.name: gas
params.description: gas object to be used in this transaction, node will pick one from the signer's possession if not provided

params.name: gas_budget
params.description: the gas budget, the transaction will fail if the gas cost exceed the budget

methods.name: sui_moveCall
methods.description: Create an unsigned transaction to execute a Move call on the network, by calling the specified function in the module of a given package.

params.name: signer
params.description: the transaction signer's Sui address

params.name: package_object_id
params.description: the Move package ID, e.g. `0x2`

params.name: module
params.description: the Move module name, e.g. `devnet_nft`

params.name: function
params.description: the move function name, e.g. `mint`

params.name: type_arguments
params.description: the type arguments of the Move function

params.name: arguments
params.description: the arguments to be passed into the Move function, in [SuiJson](https://docs.sui.io/build/sui-json) format

params.name: gas
params.description: gas object to be used in this transaction, node will pick one from the signer's possession if not provided

params.name: gas_budget
params.description: the gas budget, the transaction will fail if the gas cost exceed the budget

params.name: execution_mode
params.description: Whether this is a Normal transaction or a Dev Inspect Transaction. Default to be `SuiTransactionBuilderMode::Commit` when it's None.

methods.name: sui_pay
methods.description: Send Coin<T> to a list of addresses, where `T` can be any coin type, following a list of amounts, The object specified in the `gas` field will be used to pay the gas fee for the transaction. The gas object can not appear in `input_coins`. If the gas object is not specified, the RPC server will auto-select one.

params.name: signer
params.description: the transaction signer's Sui address

params.name: input_coins
params.description: the Sui coins to be used in this transaction

params.name: recipients
params.description: the recipients' addresses, the length of this vector must be the same as amounts.

params.name: amounts
params.description: the amounts to be transferred to recipients, following the same order

params.name: gas
params.description: gas object to be used in this transaction, node will pick one from the signer's possession if not provided

params.name: gas_budget
params.description: the gas budget, the transaction will fail if the gas cost exceed the budget

methods.name: sui_payAllSui
methods.description: Send all SUI coins to one recipient. This is for SUI coin only and does not require a separate gas coin object. Specifically, what pay_all_sui does are: 1. accumulate all SUI from input coins and deposit all SUI to the first input coin 2. transfer the updated first coin to the recipient and also use this first coin as gas coin object. 3. the balance of the first input coin after tx is sum(input_coins) - actual_gas_cost. 4. all other input coins other than the first are deleted.

params.name: signer
params.description: the transaction signer's Sui address

params.name: input_coins
params.description: the Sui coins to be used in this transaction, including the coin for gas payment.

params.name: recipient
params.description: the recipient address,

params.name: gas_budget
params.description: the gas budget, the transaction will fail if the gas cost exceed the budget

methods.name: sui_paySui
methods.description: Send SUI coins to a list of addresses, following a list of amounts. This is for SUI coin only and does not require a separate gas coin object. Specifically, what pay_sui does are: 1. debit each input_coin to create new coin following the order of amounts and assign it to the corresponding recipient. 2. accumulate all residual SUI from input coins left and deposit all SUI to the first input coin, then use the first input coin as the gas coin object. 3. the balance of the first input coin after tx is sum(input_coins) - sum(amounts) - actual_gas_cost 4. all other input coints other than the first one are deleted.

params.name: signer
params.description: the transaction signer's Sui address

params.name: input_coins
params.description: the Sui coins to be used in this transaction, including the coin for gas payment.

params.name: recipients
params.description: the recipients' addresses, the length of this vector must be the same as amounts.

params.name: amounts
params.description: the amounts to be transferred to recipients, following the same order

params.name: gas_budget
params.description: the gas budget, the transaction will fail if the gas cost exceed the budget

methods.name: sui_subscribeEvent

params.name: filter

methods.name: sui_tblsSignRandomnessObject
methods.description: Sign an a Randomness object with threshold BLS. **Warning**: This API is a work in progress and uses insecure randomness. Please use it for testing purposes only.

params.name: object_id
params.description: The object ID.

params.name: commitment_type
params.description: The way in which the commitment on the object creation should be verified.

methods.name: sui_transferObject
methods.description: Create an unsigned transaction to transfer an object from one address to another. The object's type must allow public transfers

params.name: signer
params.description: the transaction signer's Sui address

params.name: object_id
params.description: the ID of the object to be transferred

params.name: gas
params.description: gas object to be used in this transaction, node will pick one from the signer's possession if not provided

params.name: gas_budget
params.description: the gas budget, the transaction will fail if the gas cost exceed the budget

params.name: recipient
params.description: the recipient's Sui address

methods.name: sui_transferSui
methods.description: Create an unsigned transaction to send SUI coin object to a Sui address. The SUI object is also used as the gas object.

params.name: signer
params.description: the transaction signer's Sui address

params.name: sui_object_id
params.description: the Sui coin object to be used in this transaction

params.name: gas_budget
params.description: the gas budget, the transaction will fail if the gas cost exceed the budget

params.name: recipient
params.description: the recipient's Sui address

params.name: amount
params.description: the amount to be split out and transferred

methods.name: sui_tryGetPastObject
methods.description: Note there is no software-level guarantee/SLA that objects with past versions can be retrieved by this API, even if the object and version exists/existed. The result may vary across nodes depending on their pruning policies. Return the object information for a specified version

params.name: object_id
params.description: the ID of the queried object

params.name: version
params.description: the version of the queried object. If None, default to the latest known version

AuthorityPublicKeyBytes.description: Defines the compressed version of the public key that we pass around in Sui

authSignInfo.description: authority signature information, if available, is signed by an authority, applied on `data`.

txSignature.description: tx_signature is signed by the transaction sender, committing to the intent message containing the transaction data and intent.

CheckpointContents.description: CheckpointContents are the transactions included in an upcoming checkpoint. They must have already been causally ordered. Since the causal order algorithm is the same among validators, we expect all honest validators to come up with the same order for each checkpoint content.

user_signatures.description:
This field 'pins' user signatures for the checkpoint:

* For normal checkpoint this field will contain same number of elements as transactions. * Genesis checkpoint has transactions but this field is empty. * Last checkpoint in the epoch will have (last)extra system transaction in the transactions list not covered in the signatures list

epoch_rolling_gas_cost_summary.description: The running total gas costs of all transactions included in the current epoch so far until this checkpoint.

network_total_transactions.description: Total number of transactions committed since genesis, including those in this checkpoint.

next_epoch_committee.description: next_epoch_committee is `Some` if and only if the current checkpoint is the last checkpoint of an epoch. Therefore next_epoch_committee can be used to pick the last checkpoint of an epoch, which is often useful to get epoch level summary stats like total gas cost of an epoch, or the total number of transactions from genesis to the end of an epoch. The committee is stored as a vector of validator pub key and stake pairs. The vector should be sorted based on the Committee data structure.

timestamp_ms.description: Timestamp of the checkpoint - number of milliseconds from the Unix epoch Checkpoint timestamps are monotonic, but not strongly monotonic - subsequent checkpoints can have same timestamp if they originate from the same underlining consensus commit

DevInspectResults.description: The response from processing a dev inspect transaction

effects.description: Summary of effects that likely would be generated if the transaction is actually run. Note however, that not all dev-inspect transactions are actually usable as transactions so it might not be possible actually generate these effects from a normal transaction.

results.description: Execution results (including return values) from executing the transactions Currently contains only return values from Move calls

Entry_for_SuiAddress_and_VecSet_for_SuiA.description: Rust version of the Move sui::vec_map::Entry type

Entry_for_ValidatorPair_and_TableVec.description: Rust version of the Move sui::vec_map::Entry type

oneOf.description: Transfer objects to new address / wrap in another object / coin

id.description: Sequential event ID, ie (transaction seq number, event seq number). 1) Serves as a unique event ID for each fullnode 2) Also serves to sequence events for the purposes of pagination and querying. A higher id is an event seen later by that fullnode. This ID is the "cursor" for event querying.

timestamp.description: UTC timestamp in milliseconds since epoch (1/1/1970)

oneOf.description: Move StructTag string value of the event type e.g. `0x2::devnet_nft::MintNFTEvent`

EventID.description: Unique ID of a Sui Event, the ID is a combination of tx seq number and event seq number, the ID is local to this particular fullnode and will be different from other fullnode.

oneOf.description: Return events emitted by the given transaction.
Return events emitted in a specified Move module
Return events with the given move event struct name
Return events associated with the given object
Return events emitted in [start_time, end_time] interval

endTime.description: right endpoint of time interval, milliseconds since epoch, exclusive

startTime.description: left endpoint of time interval, milliseconds since epoch, inclusive

oneOf.description: Object level event Transfer objects to new address / wrap in another object

LinkedTable_for_ObjectID.description: Rust version of the Move sui::linked_table::LinkedTable type. Putting it here since we only use it in sui_system in the framework.

MoveOption_for_ObjectID.description: Rust version of the Move std::option::Option type. Putting it in this file because it's only used here.

owner.description: The owner that unlocks this object

previousTransaction.description: The digest of the transaction that created or last mutated this object

storageRebate.description: The amount of SUI we would rebate if this object gets deleted. This number is re-calculated each time the object is mutated based on the present storage gas price.

digest.description: Base64 string representing the object digest

objectId.description: Hex code as string representing the object id

oneOf.description: Object is exclusively owned by a single address, and is mutable.
Object is exclusively owned by a single object, and is mutable. The object ID is converted to SuiAddress as SuiAddress is universal.
Object is shared, can be used by any address, and is mutable.

initial_shared_version.description: The version at which the object became shared

oneOf.description: Object is immutable, and hence ownership doesn't matter.

amounts.description: The amounts each recipient will receive. Must be the same length as amounts

coins.description: The coins to be used for payment

recipients.description: The addresses that will receive payment

PayAllSui.description: Send all SUI coins to one recipient. only for SUI coin and does not require a separate gas coin object either. Specifically, what pay_all_sui does are: 1. accumulate all SUI from input coins and deposit all SUI to the first input coin 2. transfer the updated first coin to the recipient and also use this first coin as gas coin object. 3. the balance of the first input coin after tx is sum(input_coins) - actual_gas_cost. 4. all other input coins other than the first are deleted.

coins.description: The coins to be used for payment

recipient.description: The addresses that will receive payment

PaySui.description: Send SUI coins to a list of addresses, following a list of amounts. only for SUI coin and does not require a separate gas coin object. Specifically, what pay_sui does are: 1. debit each input_coin to create new coin following the order of amounts and assign it to the corresponding recipient. 2. accumulate all residual SUI from input coins left and deposit all SUI to the first input coin, then use the first input coin as the gas coin object. 3. the balance of the first input coin after tx is sum(input_coins) - sum(amounts) - actual_gas_cost 4. all other input coints other than the first one are deleted.

amounts.description: The amounts each recipient will receive. Must be the same length as amounts

coins.description: The coins to be used for payment

recipients.description: The addresses that will receive payment

Sha3Digest.description: A representation of a SHA3-256 Digest

StakingPool.description: Rust version of the Move sui::staking_pool::StakingPool type

decimals.description: Number of decimal places the coin uses.

id.description: Object id for the CoinMetadata object

mutableReferenceOutputs.description: The value of any arguments that were mutably borrowed. Non-mut borrowed values are not included

returnValues.description: The return values from the function

updatedCoin.description: The updated original coin object after merge

updatedGas.description: The updated gas payment object after deducting payment

createdObjects.description: List of Move objects created as part of running the module initializers in the package

package.description: The newly published package object reference.

updatedGas.description: The updated gas payment object after deducting payment

newCoins.description: All the newly created coin objects generated from the split

updatedCoin.description: The updated original coin object after split

updatedGas.description: The updated gas payment object after deducting payment

SuiSystemState.description: Rust version of the Move sui::sui_system::SuiSystemState type

oneOf.description: Check that the object is committed by the consensus.
Check that the object is committed using the effects certificate.
Regular Sui Transactions that are committed on chain
Simulated transaction that allows calling any Move function with arbitrary values.

SystemParameters.description: Rust version of the Move sui::sui_system::SystemParameters type

Table.description: Rust version of the Move sui::table::Table type. Putting it here since we only use it in sui_system in the framework.

TableVec.description: Rust version of the Move sui::table::Table type. Putting it here since we only use it in sui_system in the framework.

gas.description: the gas object to be used

inputObjects.description: objects to be used in this transaction

txBytes.description: BCS serialized transaction data bytes without its type tag, as base-64 encoded string.

TransactionDigest.description: A transaction will have a (unique) digest.

TransactionEffects.description: The response from processing a transaction or a certified transaction

dependencies.description: The set of transaction digests this transaction depends on.

events.description: The events emitted during execution. Note that only successful transactions emit events

oneOf.description: Initiate an object transfer between addresses
Pay one or more recipients from a set of input coins
Pay one or more recipients from a set of Sui coins, the input coins are also used to for gas payments.
Pay one or more recipients from a set of Sui coins, the input coins are also used to for gas payments.
Call a function in a published Move module
Initiate a SUI coin transfer between addresses
A system transaction that will update epoch information on-chain.
A system transaction used for initializing the initial state of the chain.

UID.description: Rust version of the Move sui::object::Info type

Validator.description: Rust version of the Move sui::validator::Validator type
